revised_title: Coupling Between Physical and Biological Scales: A Comparative Study in Marine and Terrestrial Ecology
tldr: This article highlights the importance of understanding the interaction between physical and biological scales in marine and terrestrial ecosystems. It emphasizes that the emphasis on internal mechanisms in terrestrial studies and external physical forcing in marine populations can provide a partial description of the diverse temporal patterns observed. The article suggests that the coupling between different scales, rather than the nature of internal or external processes themselves, can help explain the variety of patterns found in both marine and terrestrial systems.
